column4: it seems to be in ubuntu - now if only Arch were so easy to use ;)
thanks again blake - you have revolutionized my workflow process lol
I don't know if any IDE's that have transparency, and I know less about Nano (vi user here). I actually started using Sublime Text 2 recently. It's an awesome editor and runs on Linux and Mac.
and it does syntax highlighting for just about everything ;-)
